1. Actuators documentation

You may find below the informations about the Actuators library. All informations needed to handle Actuators, like classes and Actuator_Manager are presented.

This library is specially uses for commanding actuators through the actuator electronic card. In the Ensmasteel bot, this card is usually an Arduino Mega. For further information, please see the “Electronics” section.

The custom library “StepperMotorJ” is also presented. See StepperMotorJ

1.1. Actuator

Enums

enum Actuator_State

Enum class to give the different states of an Actuator.

Values:

enumerator Attente

Waiting for an order.

enumerator NewMess

getting a new order

enumerator Mouvement

During the movement.

enumerator MouvFinished

Just ending the action asked.

class Actuator
#include <Actuators.h>

Basic abstract class to define an actuator

This class defines a basic class to represent an actuator. It should be decorated with the target actuator class. The constructor is public and embeddes a name and an ID wich is ‘Empty_M’ as default.

Subclassed by Bras, Pavillon, Pince

Public Functions

Actuator(String name = "Actuator", MessageID messID = MessageID::Empty_M)

Basic public constructor for Actuator class

Parameters

  • name – : the actuator name

  • messID – : The Id of the message embedded. Default is ‘Empty_M’

Returns

Actuator : An instance of Actuator.

virtual Actuator_State Update()

Virtual method, to call before each loop.

Commands each actuator and updates the robot state.

void NewOrder(Actuator_Order order)

Getter of a new order.

Parameters

order –

inline Message OrderCompleted()

Generates the validating message from the action dedicated to the order sender.

Returns

the validation message

inline String GetName()

Returns the actuator name

Returns

name : the actuator name

inline Actuator_State GetEtat()

Returns the actuator state

Returns

state : the current state

inline Actuator_Order GetOrder()

Returns the current order the actuator has.

Returns

current Order : the current order.

inline MessageID GetID()

Returns the message ID of the current message actually in the actuator.

Returns

messID

class Pavillon : public Actuator
#include <Actuators.h>

Public class extending the actuator abstract class.

Used to define the ‘Pavillon’ actuator. Deprecated for the 2022 edition.

class Bras : public Actuator
#include <Actuators.h>

Public class that extends the abstract actuator class.

Enables you to create a class containting the information to control a robot arm equipped with a servomotor and 2 positions : the initial pos and the deployed position. Both are given in degrees.

Public Functions

Bras()

Public basic constructor. Does not require any parameters.

void Init(uint8_t pinServo, MessageID ID, int posRentre = 0, int posSortie = 100)

Initialises the robot arm with some parameters.

Enables you to give the initial parameters to the arm previously instantiated.

Parameters

  • pinServo – : the pin number on wich the servomotor is connected.

  • ID – : The message ID of the default state of the arm

  • posRentre – The angle given in degree of the initial position.

  • posSortie – The angle given in degree of the final position.

virtual Actuator_State Update() override

Virtual method, to call before each loop.

Commands each actuator and updates the robot state.

Private Members

int posRentre = 0
int posSortie = 100
uint8_t pinServo
Servo servo
class Pince : public Actuator
#include <Actuators.h>

The public class to construct a robot gripper. Extends the abstract class Actuator.

This class is deprecated in the 2022 edition.

Subclassed by PinceArriere, PinceAvant

Public Functions

Pince()

Basic public constructor with no params.

void Init(uint8_t pinServo, uint8_t pinDir, uint8_t pinStep, uint8_t pinSleep, uint8_t pinM0, uint8_t pinM1, MessageID ID, int ferme = 70, int ouvert = 100, int actionStep = 400)

Initializing function. Enables you to give the primary parameters to the pince.

Parameters

  • pinServo – : the pin number on wich the gripper is connected.

  • pinDir – : the pin number on wich the direction is given to the stepperMotor.

  • pinStep – : the pin number giving the step information to the stepperMotor

  • pinSleep – : the pin number giving the sleep information to the stepperMotor

  • pinM0 – : the pin number of the first motor of the stepperMotor.

  • pinM1 – : the second pin number of the stepperMotor.

  • ID – : Default message ID of the stepperMotor

  • ferme – : The initial position given in degrees.

  • ouvert – : The final position given in degrees.

  • actionStep – : The step of the stepperMotor.

virtual Actuator_State Update() override

Virtual method, to call before each loop.

Commands each actuator and updates the robot state.

Protected Attributes

Servo servo
StepperMotorJ *stepperMotor

uint8_t pinDir
uint8_t pinStep
uint8_t pinSleep
uint8_t pinM0
uint8_t pinM1
uint8_t motorSteps = 200
long actionStep = 400
int posFermee = 70
int posOuverte = 100
int standardDelay = 2000

Defines

class Manager
#include <Actuators_Manager.h>

Basic class to declare an actuator manager wich will organize all the actions during the match.

Public Functions

Public constructor of the manager. Get 2 parameters :

Parameters

  • serControllerStream – : stream on which the information will transit in the robot itself.

  • serDebug – : Serial port to show information during debugging.

1.3. StepperMotorJ

class StepperMotorJ
#include <StepperMotorJ.h>

Custom class to control a stepperMotor.

Public Functions

StepperMotorJ(int stepPin, int dirPin, int sleepPin, int pinM0, int pinM1)

Public constructor of the StepperMotor.

Parameters

  • stepPin – : pin number of the step pin.

  • dirPin – : pin number of the direction pin.

  • sleepPin – : pin number of the sleep pin.

  • pinM0 – : pin number of the first motor.

  • pinM1 – : pin number of the second motor.

void move(int steps, int delay, bool up, bool holdPosition)

Method to make the motor move.

Parameters

  • steps – : number of steps that the stepper has to do.

  • delay – : duration while the stepper should wait for the next action.

  • up –

  • holdPosition – : Bool, represent whether the stepper should wait in final position or go back to the initial one.

Private Members

int stepPin
int dirPin
int sleepPin
int pinM0
int pinM1
